entry.title: Letters I didn't send
entry.summary:
Author: eliixbrown

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,606Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 0

Summary: When you were shot, part of me died. I was so scared Eddie. And look I know you don’t like me saying that it should have been me, but it should have been. Chris doesn’t deserve to grow up without you. So I would sacrifice myself every time if necessary. Sometimes when I think about what happened the taste of blood rushes through my mouth. Because I tasted your blood, and I know that I will never forget that taste. I’ve tasted your blood but not your lips. It kills me to even think about it.   Because it reminded me that losing you isn’t something I’d survive. Or: After Eddie leaves for El Paso Buck goes back to therapy and Dr Copeland gives him some homework.

entry.title: Right Down Santa Claus Lane
entry.summary:
Author: orionandhisdog

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,549Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 11

Summary: Buck always thinks Eddie is hot, but there’s something about Eddie wearing a Santa suit, red velvet hiding chiseled muscles and softening all of his defined edges, that is driving Buck extra crazy. Not to mention the curly white beard that hides the entire lower half of Eddie’s face, leaving his beautiful brown eyes peering out, displeasure at his predicament incredibly evident every time he glares at Buck between photo-ops. Objectively, Eddie looks ridiculous. In Buck’s very subjective opinion, however, Eddie could wear a clown suit and still be the hottest person in the room.or Eddie has to dress up as Santa for an event at the fire station. Buck enjoys it a lot more than Eddie.

entry.title: Second Chances
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 519,563Chapters: 57/?Kudos: 67

Summary: Bobby and Athena are just two people trying to put their lives back together while figuring out how to co-parent. What starts as a complicated plan to foster kids in need slowly turns into something much deeper. Through the ups and downs of heartbreak, healing, and raising children who’ve been through so much, they find strength in each other. Over time, their partnership grows into love, and together, they build a story about family, trust, and second chances.

entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 316,594Chapters: 50/?Kudos: 23

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn’t end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they’re reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

entry.title: The Price of Power
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 208,268Chapters: 36/?Kudos: 20

Summary: Athena Carter and Bobby Nash couldn’t be more different. She’s the disciplined “good girl” with her future mapped out, while he’s the dangerous bad boy with one foot in college and the other in the streets. When their worlds start to collide, what begins as a bitter rivalry quickly sparks into something deeper neither of them can ignore. But falling for Bobby means stepping into a world Athena never imagined, one ruled by loyalty and violence. That tested everything she thought she knew about herself. As sparks turn to fire, Athena must decide if love is worth the risk of losing everything.

entry.title: The Cut That Always Bleeds
entry.summary:
Author: avahh_14

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,093Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 8

Summary: "Hold on! I'm almost there!" Just then, Eddie heard a gut-wrenching creak. A sound that you never want to hear when you're on a sketchy rope bridge, on a mountain, in the middle of nowhere, above a very intimidating river. "Stop moving!" It creaked again. This time Buck heard it. With him being closer, Eddie could see his facial expressions better. He furrowed his brows and put his arms out to stabilize himself. Eddie looked closer and saw that the rope was beginning to snap in between them. There was no time to make it to Buck, or for Buck to make it to him. There was no time to make it off the bridge. They were stuck. "Grab the rail, Buck! Hurry!" Buck looked up at him, rushing over to the edge and grabbing the rope railing with both hands. Almost immediately after, they both looked at each other in horror as the rope snapped right in the middle of them, swinging them both towards opposite ends of the mountain. * Or: Buck is presumed dead, and amidst his grieving, Eddie takes home a dog that he saw was about to be abandoned on the street. So much happens before and after that but that was the og premise and i snatched that bitch and RAN with it.

entry.title: Nobody's Son
entry.summary:
Author: funnyfeelingbuckley

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 39,467Chapters: 11/?Kudos: 236

Summary: Buck’s phone starts ringing in his pocket. He sighs and checks the caller ID, staring in confusion at the unfamiliar number. “Uh, hello?” “Hello there, is this Evan Buckley?” A woman’s voice is heard through the phone. “May I ask who’s calling?” “My name is Hope Williams, from Child Protective Services. I was wondering if you had a moment to schedule a meeting on behalf of Charlotte Davis?” “I-I’m sorry, I think you must have called the wrong Evan Buckley. Who is Charlotte Davis?”   Or Buck finds out he has a 7-year-old daughter. Buck finds out a lot of stuff, actually. Title based on the Sabrina Carpenter song

entry.title: Things We Don't Say
entry.summary:
Author: Ifallinlovewithfictionalboys

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 141,790Chapters: 21/23Kudos: 79

Summary: “What are you doing? You have to keep moving.”   “I never told you I’m from LA.”   Dr. Sol’s eyes widen, and he takes a step back.   “Howard–”   “Don’t.” He lets out an animaltic growl, “Don’t say anything unless it’s to explain what the hell is going on and why there is a Korean gang looking for me.”   “Mafia.” Dr. Sol corrects, “I don’t know what they want from you, I just know of them. Now please, you must go back to L.A. Your pack needs you.”  ---After seven months of being presumed dead, Buck comes back and finally reunites with his family.Now that he’s back, Buck makes it his mission to change things along the way. It’s easier than ever now that his pack knows the truth — or so he thought. Apparently, a supernatural world can make a world of a difference, and new threats are coming out of the shadows.It doesn’t help that he feels like he’s constantly forgetting something, or that Chimney is hiding secrets of his own.—PLEASE NOTE: This is part of a series, and will likely not make any sense as a stand alone.

entry.title: The Family We Chose
entry.summary:
Author: buddiecanon118

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 118,141Chapters: 14/?Kudos: 699

Summary: “Hi, I’m Eddie Diaz, Jee-Yun’s Uncle.” “Mr. Diaz, lovely to put a face to the name.” She shakes his hand quickly. “ She talks about you and your husband all the time, and so does Buck whenever he helps out.” And Eddie should correct her. He really should. He and Buck are decidedly not married, they’re not even dating. Sure, Eddie’s though about it, of course he has. They’ve been best friends for years, his son loves him, and they’ve been sleeping in the same bed since he and Christopher got back from El Paso. But Eddie’s straight, and Buck isn’t into him like that. He’s going to correct her. Definitely. He’s going to look at her and say– “Yep, that’s me.” Oh. That’s not… Or: Eddie chaperones Jee-Yun's school field trip, Buck gets jealous, and things spiral from there

entry.title: Exhaustion Lines
entry.summary:
Author: 79KJ01

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,270Chapters: 14/20Kudos: 132

Summary: Buck hears the word once — in the wrong moment, in the wrong state of mind — and it sinks its teeth in. What should have been a passing comment twists into a truth he can’t shake, convincing him that everyone in his life is worn down by the weight of him. As he withdraws, slipping further into a quiet, dangerous spiral, the people who love him fight to remind him of one thing he can’t see on his own: he was never exhausting… only terrified of being left behind. Exhausting (adj.): not someone who is too much to love — but someone too important to lose.
